strength_details: Strong modern data stack (PySpark, Airflow, AWS S3)
Well-defined responsibilities focused on ETL/ELT pipelines and data quality
concern_details: No salary range disclosed - compensation unknown
Onsite work in Liege with no visa sponsorship mentioned
Limited information on career growth paths or promotion opportunities
Vague team size and reporting structure information
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers with 3-5 years experience in PySpark and Airflow
Engineers seeking cloud-native (AWS) data pipeline development roles
Candidates interested in Data Mesh architecture implementation
Generalist data engineers comfortable with end-to-end pipeline development
probe_details: Ask about salary range and compensation structure
Inquire about team size, seniority mix, and reporting structure
Understand career progression opportunities and growth paths
Clarify expected work hours and any overtime requirements
leverage_details: Proven experience with PySpark for large-scale data processing
Experience with Data Mesh architecture implementation (nice-to-have but valuable)
summary.overall_assessment: Solid opportunity for mid-level data engineers seeking cloud-native (AWS) pipeline development with modern tools (PySpark, Airflow). Well-defined role with focus on data quality and Data Mesh architecture. Main concerns are lack of salary transparency, onsite requirement in Liege, and limited information on career growth. Good fit for candidates with 3-5 years experience in batch ETL/ELT pipelines.
